Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Hydraulic fluid contamination detected. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Improper calibration during last maintenance cycle
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Utility Hydraulics component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Replace defective component with serviceable unit from approved stock
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Establish periodic calibration schedule
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate.
Date: 05/02/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
